intro: Draba sapozhnikovii, commonly known as the Siberian rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Russia. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Draba sapozhnikovii is a hardy species adapted to cold climates and is often used in ecological restoration projects in its native habitat.
